byline.contributor: David Jolly contributed reporting from Paris and Jack Ewing from Frankfurt.

abstract: New scrutiny surrounding diesel fuel and its emissions occasioned by Volkswagen scandal is unlikely to have big impact on many Europeans' preference for diesel cars; diesel has superior fuel economy and is cheaper than gas, which is of particular concern due to high prices and taxes on fuel in Europe.
lead_paragraph: Drawn by better fuel economy and lower prices, European consumers have long leaned toward diesel, even with the ecological drawbacks.

headline.main: Despite Volkswagen Scandal, Europe’s Diesel Habit Could Be Hard to Kick
headline.print_headline: Despite Volkswagen Scandal, Europe’s Diesel Habit Could Be Hard to Kick

snippet: Drawn by better fuel economy and lower prices, European consumers have long leaned toward diesel, even with the ecological drawbacks.
